Y9EAyM6D2pAOIU21kq5R7w.text: The Slug and Lettuce in the Omni centre is a decent enough pub for one that belongs to a chain. The decor is pretty standard for this type of pub, with large squishy sofas and comfy seats to encourage you to stay longer. As with all chain pubs, it's slightly lacking in atmosphere and the bar staff aren't terribly friendly, but no worse than i expected.   The drinks are a bit more expensive than other places in the Omni Centre, but watch out for their promotions as there is always something on special offer. The food is over priced and really of a pretty poor standard. There are so many other places to eat in the centre that taste nicer and are much better value, so i generally avoid eating here.

_kqbZHJcn5lfc9-7pzM3MQ.text: This is a good place to go and relax after work but it's irritating how they do table service in some parts of it as you end up waiting for ages sometimes and they don't like it if you go up to the bar to buy drinks seperately!   However it's still good for a couple of drinks and their chips with tikka sauce is great it's about 3 but you get a huge bowl of them!

cxLq8yBGV4XWZjMkrYWbOQ.text: Slug and Lettuce... what an awesome name, I wanted to like this bar so much more than I actually did but unfortunately it was just a bit too flat for my liking. Sure, it's not bad for a swift drink but it's really nothing to write home about unfortunately. The decor is very modern and minimal and the prices are quite reasonable too but it just doesn't have any real atmosphere or charm that would make me want to come back time and time again.

meZ3wxQdFIFlcaYfNEZp7w.text: Not bad for a chain pub. Huge food portions and comfy seating. Best bar in the Omni Centre, and rarely too busy.

_ULTQg2z3KaKeKJqyM-bgA.text: Food's okay but for up market pub grub I think it's a little steep. There's a nice comfy atmosphere and it's in a handy location a little further on from Prices Street and all the shops.

VCks7AFaEtvlD1EmI_G8Tw.text: For such a central bar, reasonable prices, and great wine. Defintiely check out mid-week deals, such as any bottle of wine for 10 on Wednesdays. We may have made too good sue of that one!

2ZMFPc4B60nLO0XEIdozcg.text: i like this pub/restaurant. Nice surroundings and food not bad either. mid priced - good for something to eat before the theatre or after the shops. Access to car park without having to go outside as it is in the omni centre. always nice and clean and set out so there are lots of areas for a chat. Do a good range of snacks as well as meals

SjE4QlWT74n50cKPIBQ2KA.text: A great family resteraunt to go to located in the omni centre.It has friendly staff and theres always great offers on even through the week.The staff are also approachable.

oTyDW6cbh-CUnlrI4Xv0-A.text: Not a bad chain pub. It's reasonably priced with a good selection of food on the menu. Of course it is the usual heated up fayre you normally get in chain pubs but that seems to be the norm rather than the exception these days. All in all a great place to stop in for a bite to eat and a drink when enjoying a day shopping in Edinburgh.

5LWfMPzA_95880XYHO6PgA.text: To be fair, I've only ever eaten at the Slug and Lettuce on their half price Mondays. I think it's a bargain for the amount of food you get, but if I were paying full price, it would be a tad too expensive for what you get. Overall, staff are always as attentive as possible, considering it can be quite busy on a Monday with all the penny pinchers like me!

qJYUoFvXAFrfDl8HPcdgQA.text: The Slug and Lettuce is fine for a drink before or after the cinema but it has no real character or charm, as with most chain pubs. I had the worst nachos here, they used flavoured Doritos instead of plain nachos and there was hardly any salsa or sour cream, it was really just a plate of dry Doritos. It was very disappointing and I won't eat here again. There are so many pubs in Edinburgh with character and atmosphere and this one just didnt stand out in any way for me. The sofas were comfy though.

xYmedXxMeZNGu3u3pnQMmA.text: The Slug in the Omni centre is a great little pub. The drinks and food are part of usual fare you get. The atmosphere of the pub is really nice. It's central, great to meet people, with plenty of options around to continue the night. Sitting on the sofa's out the main door is great for people watching. Good place to visit!

Q-qITgKEm7ZqzfrhAwk0Mw.text: This is a great bar for pre-theatre at the Playhouse. Food is distinctly bar food and average but does the trick. Friendly staff but chaotic service or no service at all if they are busy!

Awzazd5j7RzDbP58Njeagw.text: All I got to say is 1/2 price entire menu!! And the food was good too! Clean atmosphere and prices that couldn't be beat!

j3uNr0oIzfgDLLqU-EIjXQ.text: Just want everyone to know that the slug & lettuce kicked my family and I out of this restaurant because we just wanted to have some drinks. Their policy is that a party with children (aka a "family") MUST have meals off the menu and "snacks don't count". That makes no sense whatsoever, as basically they're letting me know my business is not important to them, but it was hard to get further information as the server didn't seem to understand the policy either, and if she did she certainly couldn't explain it to us.   Lest anyone think we were running amok it was two adults a 15 and 7yo and literally minutes after we sat down and said we were just having drinks we were asked to "please leave". This was quite upsetting, embarrassing and confusing  Anyway, I can't swear to it but I'm pretty sure that's illegal as there was a group of for adults just having drinks. I don't think a restaurant can discriminate based on age/ family status.  So if you're a family they don't want your business and if you're not a family do you really want to support a business that discriminates?

LhGTU6Yy6fhNVTNAx4R6TA.text: Overall not impressed. I wasn't really expecting very much and certainly wasn't disappointed. The cocktails were cheap, so that was good but as I ordered the same one each time they all tasted very different as did my friends, food took an age to arrive ( I think about 40 mins) and it was fine. All of the staff chatting round one end of the bar however wasn't fine, I know it was a Sunday but if you are working pay your clients some attention! Overall the decor is nice, the food is fine, tastyish and cheap but service terrible x

FPsyw4fR9SZMSMiEY4fxmw.text: For some reason my friend always wants to go here for drinks, even though it's in the omni centre. I think the reason might be the half price cocktails! :D I don't really like the omni centre because it's full of expensive fast-food chains, the slug and lettuce is the best option from all of them. It looks more charming and relaxed than the other places, and the food isn't horrible. With the look and feel of the place, I kind of expected a classier menu, but it is just pub food! Don't be fooled :) The 2 for 1 cocktail deal is really the reason to go here with a group of girls, not the atmosphere or the food. The cocktails are delivered quick, they're cheap and they're well tasty :)

RYNOYq_489HMS3AG6lL9zg.text: The slug and lettuce is good for food but having tried every mocktail available, all 4 of them I have yet to find one that doesn't make the back of my throat feel like I've swallowed razor blades and disappointing that a virgin pina colada isn't on the menu, and I'm no snob but sometimes the clientele of the slug and lettuce is like a night out in Mood. This would be on the bottom of my list of places to go. Harsh but True.

FJYi1JFZOj13Mf2ttT-Lag.text: As part of a national chain they do alright. I've been here twice and both times the food was acceptable, nothing out of this world but not bad either. The service is average as well. The last time I was here it was a bit awkward when I walked in with my friends. There was no hostess to greet us and we just stood there waiting to be seated while several servers walked past us, stared at us, and proceeded to ignore us. Finally one attentive waiter asked us if we were waiting to be seated and we said yes. Why else would we be standing there looking expectant? The best thing about this place is the great daily deals. 50% off food on Mondays, 2-4-1 curries on Tuesdays! You can't beat that.   Also, as a vegan I was happy to see that they have one completely vegan (and healthy!) meal on the menu, the sweet potato salad. It was actually quite good, I'd order it again. Before I was vegan (was vegetarian) I had the veg curry (has dairy in it) which was just okay, obviously not as good as a curry from a proper Indian eatery.

WDVm3ZHe32OeYK2XCEpoBg.text: Slug & Lettuce makes me think of a restaurant in an airport.  The food is alright, I enjoyed my Italian Burger, a chicken breast with pesto, mozzarella and tomato. The chips let it down a lot. I wasn't impressed by anything they brought out but I was filled with chicken so fairly satisfied. It was a bit pricey given the quality though.Think Wetherspoons-esque menu but a burger is a tenner.   Cocktails are half price at the weekends. There's a decent selection but honestly Ms. Lightweight over here could barely feel them. They were tasty in that 'Sugar is tasty' way.   The restaurant and the bar are separated, which I approve of and the tables and chairs were well spaced out. We didn't have anyone earwigging and it was easy to ignore those around us. The whole place has a 'modern' look to it, which is where I get my airport impression. You can tell they've gone for simple and reasonably minimalist but didn't want to go too far. The crowd was mainly tourists it seems, with a few locals, particularly large groups of wine drinking middle aged women. There was a few lads dotted around who I imagine would be 'suits' Monday-Friday. They clearly get a lot of the out-to-the-cinema trade too.  The staff were lovely. They were clearly run off their feet but they were on the ball and friendly whenever they came over or we called them while they were in the middle of something. There was even some banter.  Overall it was a decent meal in a decent place but if I had a choice I'd head somewhere with more character.

4pNHvcaj2ke-6tNKlvPngw.text: many years ago i crossed the thershold of Slug and Lettuce for a post movie drink on a sort of date/sort of not a date evening.  the venue was fine, my gin and tonic was fine but besides that i can't really remember much else.  however i was pleasantly surprised when i crossed the threshold again this past friday for pre movie dinner and drinks with some friends.  the place itself has had a massive refurb (i think quite recently...) so it's now all bring colours and fancy light fixtures.  the refurb has really made it into a nice light space which if i recall correctly is certainly an improvement from itself previous look.  now coming to a chain restaurant i don't set my expectations high.  food is usually standard and very often not made entirely on the premises.  so with this in mind we looked over the food menu and decide to share the poppy seed crown with warm manchego fondue and veggie crudites and a  chicken flatbread tostada between three of us.  this was accompained by a few cocktails as their whole cocktail menu is half price on friday!  normally i probably wouldn't have bothered as their cocktails are fairly pricey- nothing under the 8 mark on the menu, but half priced meant i could basically get two for the price of one.  food arrived and we were pleasantly surprised by how tasty it was.  the manchego fondue was quite nice although came in a rather small pot for a sharing dish.  the poppy seed crown was warm and although possibly just heated up in the oven seemed it could also have been fresh baked.  the flatbread tostada was more like a wrap that had been topped with some chicken and cheese/artichoke spread then slightly warmed.  it was ok, fairly tasty but not by any means amazing.  since all this sharing meant small portions we decided to have dessert as well and i ordered the chocolate and caramel bar.  this actually turned out to be incredibly good with a nice balance of rich chocolate and salted caramel toffee sauce in the middle.  it was also a good portion size that would make it ideal for sharing.  after finishing off our second cocktail we paid our bill and were on our way.  while two courses and two cocktails only came to 20 i'm not sure how value this was for money.  the cocktails were just ok with my passionfruit bellini tasty mostly of sugary passionfruit syrup and less of the actual prosecco.  the amaretto sour i had was nice but again not very strong on the alcohol front.  so overall for a chain restaurant this place is decent, it has good menu options and half priced cocktails on a friday.  it's definitely a step up from the nearby wetherspoons and i'd happy go here for a quick cheap eat before a movie again.

60HC7PO2ShgKtlVYvLBb4g.text: Loved the atmosphere of the place, the food was great and the service was speedy! I had one of the pies and it was very yummy and filling. Definitely recommend it!

moJak-wqGZkQ1WLzXiq3WA.text: I don't mind this pub as maybe I should do. The whole thing is very easy-wipe pleasant with no real heart and soul. The surroundings aren't bad and everything's mid priced.  It's main selling point is that its convenient for a wee glass of inoffensive wine before the cinema, but if you're not pushed for time then just toddle along to broughton street where everythings a bit more special. Fit for purpose non the less.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lSZ1QLybtg6kezVEgxmVQg.text: The Slug & Lettuce is modern with lots of nice cozy sofas and plump chairs to relax in after a hard days shopping over the road at Harvey Nicks.  This bar is in the Omni Centre so its really handy for having a swift pint or two before watching a movie or grabbing a bite to eat at our fav tapas, La Tasca.  They have a full menu but we've only had the starters here - they were pretty tasty though. Service is good and the barstaff are always pleasant.   There's parking right underneath as well which is a plus in this city !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

m0dJ5q1AStKlh-KkPwRjDA.text: Located in the Omni Centre, this bar is ideal for something to drink or eat before the cinema or theatre. As Michael said, there is plenty of nice big leather sofas to collapse into for a night of drinking.   It is like Wetherspoons but one up the posh scale. I haven't eaten here but have seen a lot of cheap deals on Student Beans for this chain, so might be worth a go. There isn't anything overly special or exciting about this bar. Just a standard bar with comfy sofas selling reasonably priced drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Courtesy of Slug and Lettuce Website

RbcOIzccxfg5U3JKyHswXA.text: I arrived at the Slug and Lettuce having spent roughly 6 or 7 hours in a car home from Alton Towers. I had a numb bum, tired eyes and a rumbly tummy so we decided something quick and easy will do. My friend was desperate for a Sunday Roast so this place fitted the bill.  Or so we thought, after being shown to a table and deciding on what we wanted we were told there was no Sunday Roast left...... I saw his eyes sink a little. Gutted. On a side note, please either decide if you are going to have table service or order at the bar, I find the mix of the two really rather bizzare.  So, I ordered a Mojito as cocktails are half price at the weekends!? Meh, I would not have it again if I were to return. It was a little lacklustre. I then had a butternut squash, spinach and goats cheese lasagne - sounds yum, tasted yum. Up until an hour or so later, I did not feel well and having eaten nothing else I can't see what else could have made me feel so queasy. Rather disappointing really, wish I had gone somewhere a little more exciting.

Aw0bHPxREqMANDXHo94lmQ.text: Distinctly tepid soup, an eclectic car-crash menu, and friendly but slow service. This is not the recipe for a happy lunchtime.  Overall, we said: "the Slug & Lettuce wasn't great. They absolutely, categorically need to chop their menu at least in half, if not further than that. They have eight different burger options, sitting next to a similar number of curry options, sitting next to a broad range of pasta options, and from what I could see, none of it looked too appetizing. They need to focus on a much smaller number of dishes, and try to inject some quality. For now, I couldn't recommend the place."

r-bGH8xox8P5EJDYz4qvCg.text: Half priced food on mondays.  YES!   We had to wait 45 minutes to order food because the kitchen was so overloaded with orders - but the drinks we ordered in the meantime were tasty and decently priced.  I had chicken curry with rice and my husband had the steak.  Both were really delicious and you just can't beat the price.  All the entrees are fairly priced to begin with, so 50% off means they're super cheap.  All the sandwiches and burgers looked really good too and the portions were big.    Service was great.  Our server was getting slammed due to the 50% off food special, but she managed to come around a few times and apoligized for the wait.  The bar area has a great atmosphere too which made the wait managable.  My recommendation would be to come after 7PM, as it died down substantially after that.  Tuesdays they have 2-for-1 indian entrees which is a great deal too.  I would definitely go back if I lived in the area!

g62AZfJTF1fNb03tIR4Pug.text: Good place for coffee and snack, quite spacious so there is no problem with finding comfy seats.

photos.caption: Photo of Slug & Lettuce - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8R9v1Dz2EJ5vTvz3pK4e4w.text: The Slug and Lettuce may not be exciting or original but it is a reliable go-to if you are after a few drinks or bit of food before the cinema or theatre.  There's loads of space and a section at the front with really comfy leather and seats and couches if you've had a long day and want to relax.   There's quite a varied menu and everything I've ever had has always been tasty and good value for money - particuarly love the risotto and tostadas (somewhere between a fajita and a pizza) and the puddings are generous and yummy aswell. They also do an offer on Monday's where all food has 50% off which is a great bargain.  The cocktails are really basic, don't expect anything authentic or memorable but at least the service is good so you'll get it quickly!

2u38nmhiwXGAGTf3A4FMWg.text: This place always gives me the creeps!! I'm going to keep this short and simple....  It's dirty, the carpet always has food mushed into it, the tables are never cleaned properly, the wine is warm (!!), the food is horrible re-heated crap, the prices are extortionate and the staff are moody.  I;ve been here several times and come to the same conclusion. I thought it was ok because it was beside the cinema etc etc - don't make the same mistake I did!!

Or3Vl0WpZ5XWSYknwroxcw.text: This bar is absolutely fine to pop into for a drink. But I'd never eat in there again. We'd stopped in for lunch one day and I'd ordered a pasta with roasted peppers and a tomato sauce. Only it came with virtually no peppers at all (I was lucky if I had two slivers) and the sauce? What sauce?   I don't agree with paying around 8 for a bowl of bland pasta with virtually no vegetables or sauce. Hell, for that price, I could have got myself a decent two course lunch elsewhere.   Needless to say, it didn't do much for my hangover, and I couldn't bring myself to finish it either. My mate wasn't exactly fussed on hers either - so that too got left.   Bland, microwaved pre-cooked food. No value for money at all, and I just can't recommend it. Stick with the drinks. You know where you stand with those!

U5Kj-euVa2ZLoOOUHaCc2Q.text: I was very let down by this place, as i have been to various other establishments owned by the same company and the food and service was far superior! I had ordered a chicken and pasta dish, and my friend had ordered a pasta dish which was supposed to have roasted vegetables with it. Instead my chicken dish came with the roasted vegetables and my friends dish came with a miniscule amount of pasta sauce! The service was not great either, oh, and my chicken was dry! I did have soup for a starter though, and i must admit, it was nice. Thank goodness i did have that as i'd been leaving the place as hungry as i was when i walked in otherwise! I dont think i'll be back!   It is a nicely decorated place, and i have been in for a quick drink before heading to the cinema, but food wise, i'll give it a miss in future!
